author: torfbolt
content: Altona seems to be running quite smoothly. Is there some list of open points/preconditions that remain before the next testnet?

author: torfbolt
content: Something similar to the github issue for Altona?

author: donschoe
content: Technically, I don't think there is anything missing for a public testnet launch

author: donschoe
content: It's just a couple of operational things that needs to be done I believe.

author: donschoe
content: I expect that we can start working on that next week

author: djrtwo
content:
I'm in conversation with client teams. There is a little bit of stability work going on and other than that the blocker is some UX things (trying to make key management as close to mainnet as possible)

I expect we announce a date monday/tuesday

author: donschoe
content: I published the altona client metrics: https://ethresear.ch/t/ethereum-2-0-client-metrics-07-2020/7699

author: protolambda
content: <@!557201004060213248> Although not as stable yet, Lodestar made some good progress. I'm currently syncing it on Altona, on my 4 year old laptop. Customized to have BLS enabled during sync, eth2stats support, and a few other minor changes. Getting about 5 slots/second (And after BLS optimization, would estimate 10-20  slots/second). Maybe worth benchmarking next?

author: donschoe
content: Yes, great progress. I'll do another one for sure. All teams said they have optimizations in the pipeline, so it's worth repeating it or even make it a regular thing.
